title: Terry Abraham Web Archive
description: This collection consists of the papers of Terry Abraham, former head of our Special Collections and Archives department. Abraham worked at the library for 21 years and was well-known for his scholarship and service to the profession. He passed away in the spring of 2018.

title: International Jazz Collections
description: The International Jazz Collection is the premier jazz archive of the Pacific Northwest and is housed in the University of Idaho Library.

title: Potlatch Collection
description: The records of the Potlatch Lumber Company span the years 1890 to 1949, with the bulk of the material covering the years 1901 to 1932.

title: Stonewall Collection
description: A collection of over 200 books of historical significance to the LGBT rights movement, this collection features Stonewall Award-winning works.

title: Geneology Resources
description: Special Collections has many resources for your geneological search, including our Gem of the Mountains Yearbook Collection.

title: Ezra Pound Collection
description: In 1973 the Library began to collect works by and about Ezra Pound, American man of letters who was born in Hailey, Idaho, in 1885.

title: W.C. Cheney Collection
description: In 1962, W.C. Cheney presented President Theophilus with 17 55-gallon drum barrels on the condition that the barrels be opened in 2010.
